I do not mean to offend the Indian spectators that delighted on this film, I merely say that my western mentality is not prepared for this kind of humor, that's all.

title: Simply Superb !!
review:
It does put across many messages but is not preachy, at least not every time.

Raju Hirani is on a Rampage (Bombarding with awesome comic movies)

Each and every star cast was befitting. Aamir Khan has done it again. He has proved why he is called perfectionist. Sharman Joshi again proves why he may be the most undervalued actor.

Apart from these 3 Idiots i was stunned by Omi Vaidya as Chatur Ramalingam aka "The Silencer",in fact can be called the fourth hero of the movie.

Hats off guys... Aap sab Balatkari(Chamatkari) ho !!...lol...

title: An incredible, feel-good movie
review:
2009 wasn't a great year for Hindi cinema, with not many movies seeing commercial success and even fewer winning universal critical acclaim. Just as it is about to end, one movie makes up for the entire year. 3 Idiots was carrying the weight of huge expectations, and it is almost shocking to realise that those expectations can be surpassed by the product in front of you.

There are shades of Hirani's earlier movies (Munnabhai MBBS, Lage Raho Munnabhai) and even Taare Zameen Par in 3 Idiots, but that is not a bad thing at all. A movie like 3 Idiots often seems predictable, but predictable it is definitely not. Hirani's movies try to deliver strong social statements, and 3 Idiots is no exception, but in doing so, it never gets preachy. Just when the seriousness is about to border on being uncomfortable, they drop a joke that really works.

At the end of it all, the movie makes you want to tell everyone to watch it. It makes you feel good. It connects with you, tickles you, but at the same time, makes you think, without making you think too much. How Hirani does it, only he knows, but AAL IZ WELL!

title: Am I missing something this movie is mediocre and waaayy to long
review: Is it worth watching, short answer no. Is it worth watching if you are a fan of Bollywood, I guess. Is this movie anywhere near the 8.2 The world of IMDbers have given it no way. The acting is mediocre, the laughs are just ok, the obligatory dance sequences leave this American scratching his head. The length at almost 3 hours is way too long for a movie of this sort. And the hero, is well kind of a jerk not a loveable rebel (a quality I usually love to see). And there is way too much predictability in the plot. I dont watch very much Indian cinema, my favorite Indian flick is monsoon wedding, now that was a great film. This was mediocre on a good day.

title: More depth than the title implies
review:
I watched this due to the high rating on IMDB and another site.

After watching a few minutes, I thought it was just going to be a senseless comedy. However, as the story unfolds, it turns out there's more depth and twist and turn to the story then expected. I was pleasantly surprised.

I wish hollywood could make this kind of movie. But fat chance because there is no special effects, no car chase, no nudity, and no martial arts fights.

It is a very human story. Full of emotions and ups and down.

It brings smile to my face, and tears to my eyes. A great movie.

title: Meh
review:
A decent enough idea/story. For me this is just an average "disney like" movie to spend time with. There is nothing special about this movie; not funny enough, not dramatic enough.. I find this movie too melodramatic.

It is a kind of fairy tale for the smart guys, not everybody. Reality is not that easy to live in.

Besides, simplicity may be the main element of this movie but again, not strong enough. For example: the simplicity of ''American Beauty'', such strong and true.

Grab your popcorn and watch this movie if you have a lot of free time.

title: Wonderful movie
review: This is really one of the best movies I have ever seen. Even the best movie not only of its category but of all categories. This movie is excellent in the point of view of ideas, actors and it mix a love story with a well organized drama and plenty of comedy so you laugh as you never did before. The idea of the movie is realistic. I was really touched at the end and I live with all details and parts of the movie. My words cannot describe how this movie affected me and transferred me to a world of lovely people and true friendship. I hope that I see similar movies but I think I will never watch better than this film. And yes, I mean it Finally, I recommend all people from all ages to watch this film and they will sure be satisfied and will enjoy it

title: Movie for family!
review:
I watched the film and I said 'Aal Izz Well!'. I enjoyed when I was watching. After the movie,I felt like I can solve every trouble. Whatever life brings. The movie makes you laugh and in the process you learn many useful 'golden rules' which can alter your life...

For the rest, cast are amazing! BesidesiAamir Khan makes marvelous movies. This Indian actors are really sincere.

Anyway, It takes everyone by surprise. But my vote is 8 because the musical scenes were little bit bored,I think. Ggainst all odds,the movie was brilliant.

Just watch!

title: Masterpiece
review:
3 Idiots directed by Rajkumar Hirani is a masterpiece.

Since Munnabhai M.B.B.S,I have been liking movies of Hirani.His movies are not like those of Karan Johar or Priyadarshan.

The story of 3 Idiots is excellent.

Another aspect of 3 Idiots,it talks about students suicide which has become major issue in India and Hirani has crafted this subject beautifully.

The screenplay is water-tight.

The music is very good.Aal Izz Well and Zoobie Doobie are already chart-busters.Give Me Some Sunshine is lovely.Behti Hawa Sa Tha Woh is melodious.

Performances-Aamir Khan is superb.Madhavan and Sharman Joshi both excel in their respective roles.Kareena Kapoor is good.Boman Irani is amazing.Omi Vaidya is awesome!His speech is going to bring guffaws.

On the whole,3 Idiots is a must-watch!

title: One of the gems of Indian cinema.....
review:
Well with Mr perfectionist it's always something unusual,intrigue,unexpected in the card.

Every time I think it's his best he defies me and that too always in a bigger way.Keep surprising us sir that's all we love about you... Now moving on to director with 100% track record. Screenplay,direction,story everything exceptional. In this movie villain is also equally loved as any other character and so is in his other movies too. That's quite rare ability he possess. There is not a single weary moment in it.. Definitely repeat viewings I say.. This movie can't be rated on any context and therefore it comes under those category where ratings does not matter ; all matter is the awareness the love it generated in the hearts of people....special one..

title: Classic Movie
review:
For the first time, a movie has changed the definition of a English word. Idiot doesn't mean offending any more to peoples. The movie is about doing what your heart asks you to do, not what you are supposed to do specially when it comes to your career. After Munnabhai series, the combination of Rajkumar Hirani and Vidhu Vinod Chopra gives another magic in this movie which has broken all records.

Aamir, Sharman Joshi and Madhavan has come up once again after Rang De Basanti and this time even better. Omi the dÃ©butante NRI has done wonderful justice to his character specially with his funny accent and the speech he has made in the college.

title: best bollywood movie ever !
review: This movie was the bomb. Never enjoyed a bollywood movie like this. I almost cried with that scene where madhavan and sharman pull their pants down in front of amir and he turns back and cries. Best thing about this movie was Boman Irani.Loved his role. The songs were good too. Naration of madhavan was good.Sharman acted well too especially in the scene where he makes a choice between life and death. Rancho is a very likable character. Kareena plays her part good too(her luck to bag this role after some flops like kurbaan and khambat ishq). The conclusion was so unpredictable.That nerdy guy was funny too. All is well folks....best bollywood movie ever and probably amirs best movie too after lagaan.

title: Good Attempt with meaningful cinema
review:
I visited a multiplex nearby reading highly rated reviews and i can assure you I wasn't disappointed,you wouldn't be either. Lemme tell you why:-

1)Aamir Khan's performance in itself is the highlight of the movie,nobody can carry off such a bubbly,upbeat yet so since student as amir khan portrayed,so if you really wanna admire one good piece of acting then you souldn't miss Aamir Khans role in 3 idiots.

2)Laughter,more laughter and more laughter..there were barely scenes where you couldn't laugh and for the rest of the movie,or for the most of the part i had a big smile on my face cos it is that kind of light movie which never relies on sick jokes but natural comedy.

3)The acting of the Professor aka Virus or Boman Irani in real..well that has to be for me a performance of a lifetime,this man has surpassed himself and many stalwarts of acting by portraying a hyper professor who wants to win at any cost.

4)Beautiful songs,if your a music.bug no matter if you cant understand Hindi,even the instrumentals don't fail to touch your heart.

but there are some minor cons with movie specially in the second half,the pregnancy scene of Kreena's sister has been too stretcched and the movie just did'not let the audience guessing..coming to the end..i had already figured out whats going to happen?

cons are pretty minor.so if you have not seen this movie you must book a ticket now...or surely must a rent a DVD.

after watching the movie you would surely say ALL IZZ well!

title: A very good movie - forget the hoopla...
review:
3 Idiots is India's biggest grosser of all time. I am sure that is an impossible tag to live up to. So let me relieve the stress by stating that this is not the greatest Hindi movie ever - it however is a very good movie. Raju Hirani shows again that some pretty serious issues can be delivered in the most rib-ticklingly funny way.

This movie has raised all kinds of fundamental questions - but at it heart it talks about all of us living our lives doing something we love rather than what is expected by society alone. It also talks about a failed education system where our best institutes do not churn out innovation. That is real and true. We as a country put too much emphasis on academics - rather than on learning.

Back to the movie - it has some of the best written characters I have seen in a while - Rancho, Virus, Silencer and Farhan... It also has some of the funniest scenes - the wedding gate crashers, the valedictory speech and of course the ragging scene at the start. All the raucous humour takes away from some the spectacular screenplay - as the friends undertake a roadtrip to find rancho.

Few inconsistencies - that these two chaps would wake up 5 odd years later to find out about their friend (as also his lady love)...but overall it is a memorable film. Will it remain a cult film like Dil Chahta Hai or Lagaan (or even Lage Raho Munnabhai) - one that stands the test of time - not sure.

title: Climax ruins the movie...
review:
3 Idiots would have been great if the climax were little different. Rancho should have been working as a teacher in a small school (bcoz he doesn't have a degree in his name). And Chatur should've laughed at him. But Mr. Wangdu (different person) should've met Chatur and tells him how great the mind of Rancho is. Mr. Wangdu should've revealed that he worships Rancho's talent..

The climax in the movie is not realistic at all. I know it's just a movie but still it should not insult the intelligence of people.

Let's compare it with Munna Bhai MBBS. If in Munna Bhai Sanjay Dutt had become a real doctor in the climax, the movie wouldn't have been that great. (I hope you got my point)

3 Idiots could've got a rating of 8. But the climax cost it 2 points, making its rating 6..

title: Indian Tertiary Education Depicted Beautifully
review:
The actual scene of college education in India has now been exposed to the world. Pressures related to studies leading to wrong paths taken by people or suicides have been the major portion of the plot.

The movie starts with the entry of 3 young students to the ICE (best engineering institute of the country ). The starting scene of the movie clearly points out the topic that is competition is so tough in India that students , instead of improving themselves , only look to getting good grades and even mug up for 18 hours a day for the achievement. Finally , what the director conveys through the movie is that one who wants to study will study by any means and not look to better grades but improving himself and he will finally turn out to be the ultimate winner.

ACTING ---- Everybody is excellent, just the way the movie demanded. Aamir Khan , as always, weaves magic playing an 18 year old though he himself is 44. Madhavan, Sharman Joshi, and Kareena Kapoor complemented extremely well by playing their parts. Boman Irani does a typical Engineering Institute Director mastering every bit of his part. Omi Vaidya was excellent in his role especially his dialogue delivery. He is one new actor in Bollywood with some hopes in acting.

DIRECTION --- Good direction as what is expected by Raj Kumar Hirani but way too many flaws, the major flaws being :

Calling Mona Singh's character Poonam in the first half and Mona in the second half. Also, when you steal from someone's office , you do not use their land-line to call someone -- A major flaw.

Since it was a feel good movie, we can ignore scenes like the baby kicking when he listens to AAL IZZ WELL. On the whole , a good attempt on the topic , could have been better as what is expected by Aamir Khan. For me its a 7/10.

In the end, i would love to repeat an excellent quote from the movie :

" Strive for Excellence and Success will follow "

title: My review On 3 idiots
review:
HERE IS MY REVIEW ON 3 IDIOTS. Hope you Like it

STORY: The story Is Simple. Not much borrowed From Five point someone. But the Modification Done is Exlempry. Really Rajkumar Hirani put a lot off effort in making a modification. And he Represented the story into such a way we really thought for a second that if STUDIES are only meant for the marks, BUT Most important He Made us see What the Best students Can do for you. I will rate the story 4.5/5

ACTING: Acting is one of the Strongest Criteria in 3 idiots. Lets start from the beginning. *

In 3 idiots Sharman Joshi is at its best. Watch out his expression when the Virus tells that he will be suspended if he did not tell him who is with him last night so that he can suspend them.

Madhavan does a decent job in playing as Farhan Quareshi.He is very very perfect at times, but sometimes got overboard as like in the scene when Virus spotted him in the wedding, he really did't know what to do at that time.

BOMAN IRANI in his one of his finest performance ever. It is Enough to tell him about his performance

Kareena Kapoor just plays himself. No special review for her

Supporting Characters are really Good but the special mention goes to Omi Vaidya. He tops the Performance table in 3 idiots. Should i Add something more?

AAMIR KHAN . H Really plays Rancho so perfectly we forgot Aamir khan is the 44 year superstar. But in some scenes he tries hard to be college boy. Like during the Song AAL IZZ WELL When he was Taking calculation of plane he sees up for 1 second like he was something revising. Thats the thing that a primary child do.

I will rate it 4/5

CINEMATOGRAPHY: Cinematography was really the best. You can see the The level of extent of cinematography During BEHKTI HAWA JAISE THA WOH song. rating it 4.0/5

SCREENPLAY DIRECTION: I have no words to express the screenplay and direction. Just rating it 9/10

SOME GOOFS: There are some Goofs that I would I like to share

*One goof written in IMDb that They traveled from Delhi to Manali continuously for 12 hrs with no night scene

*How many Colleges Have the direct Contact Between the Dean and students and especially in the No 1 college of India. By looking 3 idiots I started to feel that there is only one batch studying in the college

BIGGEST GOOF * When Farhan Quareshi Sees the Group Photograph of BATCH. he sees that Javed Jaffery was sitting right to the Boman Irani. Didin"t Boman Irani Have realized that The person sitting next to him was not rancho and that even so when ranch has got most popularity in the college. did"t Someone realized that he is not the person in his session and why he was sitting in the place of rancho.

VERDICT : MUST WATCH. Reducing it 1 mark for Somewhat Unrealism

20.5/25 = 82%PERCENT = 8/10

title: Truly idiotic story setup but very much entertaining.
review: 3 Idiots,another new Aamir Khan starer comes to our Indian cinema.That guys just only knows to give decent performances and attract crowds with stupendous acting.No doubt,he is the best we get from Indian Cinema.The plot for the movie is very much idiotic but nevertheless it leaves a great moral in the end for upcoming youth.Boman Irani as usual is pretty terrific and Kareena Kapoor looks stunning.Madhavan and Sharman Joshi also have done very well in their support roles.Good decent comedy movie.This one's for all ages i suppose.Nothing as such of that much nudity and vulgar stuff in this.After all its an Aamir Khan starer,you just have to watch it.Some things in the movie look ridiculous like birth of a child with the help of Vaccum Cleaner but no doubt it was very much entertaining.Good comedy,good moral and Of course Aamir Khan.Very entertaining.But you cannot miss this one.

title: A total laugh riot and definitely a must in top 250 all time
review:
I went out to the movie with great expectations as it pitched Aamir Khan with Raju Hirani. Oh boy.. this was an awesome movie which presented the Indian education system with a large dose of comedy interspersed by the "It- moments".

Aamir's body language as 22 year student is what keeps this movie alive throughout the film. Kareena is fresh and hot in the 'Joobi doobi' song. Maddy is adorable and so is sharman, who tickles you with his old mannered illustrations. Though the surprise package of the movie comes from the character of NRI student who enacted the role of a NERD to utter perfection. The professor's characterization is mind blowing which makes you stand up by looking at him as well laugh at him.

It has a lot of touching moments as well, with out making it too preachy. This is one of the genuine movies that came from Bollywood stable this year...

After watching this movie, I felt this, "If you haven't felt for the guy who sings the song - Give me some sun shine, then you r a total emotion less guy". That's the impact this film had. Go for it.. have a blast.

title: Aal is well!! WAT A MOVIE!!!
review: 3 idiots is a superb movie. It has comedy, drama, romance, all mixed into 1. This movie can be watched with the family, as it is not vulgar. Aamir Khan steals the show, he is outstanding as a 20 year old man, he plays his part with fascinating levels of energy. R Madhavan was a very good and funny. Sharman Joshi was very funny too and plays his very good. Boman Irani is fantastic, his lisp is so funny. Kareena Kapoor has nothing to do really, she did not have a very big part in the film SILENCER was brilliant was definitely the funniest character in the movie by far. My Rating : 10/10 my verdict : go 4 it..............................!!! :)

title: Munnabhai Chale College
review:
3 Idiots is Rajkumar Hirani's latest offering after his previous socially-relevant Munnabhai series films. This time, he doesn't have Sanjay Dutt and Arshad Warsi. So, this time we have Aamir Khan, Sharman Joshi and R. Madhavan playing college students. The hype is tremendous. But what about the movie? Our heroes enter a top engineering college with shining eyes full of dreams, and hopes for a better future. Life gives them a reality check in the shape of Viru Sahastrabuddhe, their dominating principal who believes that life is a race, and that is the only way it has to be lived. Rancho, (Aamir Khan, looking surprisingly youthful, but still older than an engineering student) keeps motivating his friends to learn rather than mug the subjects. While most people refuse to take the path less traveled, Rancho continues to excel on this path, and even beat those who take the conventional track. The frequent run-ins with the Principal, what happens to the friends in college is what forms the crux of the story.

Loosely based on Five Point Someone, the story has been reworked and actually improved upon; but the screenplay loses some of the Raju Hirani charm. To make things understood in simple terms, he sometimes takes the help of measures that are not only over the top, but sometimes unbelievable. Why a principal would not rusticate a student after so many insubordinations and misdemeanors is beyond measure. The delivery scene looks incredulous as well. Some things can be termed cinematic liberties, but others leave you confused.

Raju Hirani the director is in top form again. His affection for socially-relevant comedies sees him unveiling a new phrase 'All eez well' to follow in the footsteps of 'Jaadu ki jhappi' and 'Gandhigiri'. In my opinion, 'Lage Raho Munnabhai' was his best effort to date, and even though he doesn't reach those peaks with Idiots, it is very good work indeed. He is the star of the show.

Aamir Khan as Rancho does extremely well, considering he is the most out of age in this movie. With constantly widened eyes and loose clothes, he gets into the skin of the tireless learner-cum-inventor. Though things he does look incredulous, he mostly makes them feel real. Sharman Joshi and Madhavan as his friends who are on the rote path only to be 'enlightened' by Khan are competent. Joshi is especially good in the principal's office scene. Kareena Kapoor is good in a brief, albeit important role. The real scene-stealer though, has to be Omi Vaidya. The actor steals the show as the stereotypical opposite of Rancho, Chatur. Note his expressions in the speech scene. Hilarious! Boman Irani as the principal is good, but the unnecessary lisp in his voice could have been avoided.

Shantanu Moitra's compositions are situational and complement the narration. Zoobi Doobi sticks out like a sore thumb though, and seems more like an item song. Jaane Nahi Denge Tujhe tides over a tough period in the story, while Behti Hawa serves as an excellent introduction. The background score serves its purpose.

Binod Pradhan's cinematography is commendable. I spent half an hour dissecting the introduction scene with a friend and we still could not figure out how it was done. The set design is good. The special effects, though minimal, are well executed.

Final Verdict: With 3 idiots, Raju Hirani stays in the Munnabhai franchise, albeit with different actors. The story has its heart in the right place, but the execution is far from perfect. Still, I'm going with 3.5 out of 5 for this look at the education system.

title: A good movie and a clever adaptation
review:
The whole nation is going gaga over 3 idiots..and heres my chance to do the same but in a more fair way. I would be totally honest with this review. Movie was very good. not excellent. if you are thinking whether to watch the film or not, I would say go watch it ASAP. but why did I say its not excellent? because I have read the book and I couldn't help but notice the scenes inspired from the book. The plot of the movie is different but many things have been restored from the book and that did not give me a fresh feeling about the movie. Also another point I would like to add is that movie was very very predictable. I was able to guess who Phun Suk is..I was able to guess what would happen with Joy and I was able to guess many other things which were supposedly twists in the story.

Music: well it sounds just above ordinary in my car but in the movie the songs blended very well and there was no boring moment during the songs.

Acting: Aamir was brilliant in most of the scenes, but in few scenes I felt he tried too hard to come out as a youngster. Madhavan and Sharman were equally good. Boman's character took some time to get accustomed to but he did a great job of convincing you with his accent and way of talking. Kareena did not have much to do in this movie but she did a decent job. The surprise package in the movie is Omi. His speech scene is going to be a landmark in 2009 for Hindi film industry.

Movie on the whole: Story is pretty good and decent changes made by Script writers after taking off from the book. Direction is also very good with certain aspects coming out really well like the black and white scenes and the way it starts with madhavan getting out of flight etc etc. movie has a good amount of comedy instilled in it which makes the movie enjoyable all along. I personally felt some parts were ridiculous like baby kicking after hearing certain words and Sharman's jump from 3rd floor etc etc. But on the whole Movie is a must watch because of its fresh subject, different story and approach, comedy and good performances by all the cast. I give it 8/10. go watch and enjoy.

title: Its just a Good Business
review:
Be ready to see Munna-Bhai in an Engineering college. An engineering college where our 45 year old heroes are studying. An average, over-hyped movie.

First half is relatively good, however second half is a complete drag. Most of the research shown in the movie can at best be categorised as "JUGAD". Movie is good in pieces and some scenes are extremely good especially, Hindi Speech scene, which is definitely a masterpiece. But good movie does not mean few good scenes, the complete package has to be good. Further, at some places this movie was an adaptation of Chetan Bhagat's book-FPS and where it was not it was a copy of Munna-Bhai, like ragging scene, tussle with College Director, love affair with Director's daughter etc.

Overall, there is some entertainment, but it is just an average comedy movie, NOT the all time great etc etc. 6/10.

title: Synopsis
review:
Castings : Rancho (Aamir Khan, The change agent), Raju (Sharman Joshi) and Farhan (Madhvan). Professor Virus. Imperial college of Engineering (ICE). New Delhi. Chatur.

Farhan always wanted to be wild life photographer. But his father had decided that his son will grow up to be an engineer. He was getting the lowest grades in ICE even when he studied hard. Rancho identified his talent and helped him become a wild life photographer. Rancho sent his photos to the famous photographer abroad. In the end of college, he was able to convince his father that his real love is photography and he will never be able to become a good engineer. His father relented and offered to buy him a professional camera.

Raju belonged to a very poor family. His father was suffering from paralysis and mother was a retired school teacher. He also had a elder sister who was unmarried. Prospective groom was asking for a Maruti 800 for marrying her. Her mother was a really sapping character but every sad mother is like that only. Raju is very religious and prays daily. He had picture of deities in front of his study table. In the end, he acquire the right attitude which impressed the interviewers and got him a job offer. He didn't fear anymore. Neither death nor poverty.

Since I made a generalized comment on mothers let me dig deep into it. Mothers are different kind of creatures. Usually one finds fear and greed in people. Like greedy people are always more fearful also and vice versa. But in mothers, fear is accompanied by love and not greed.

Kareena was the daughter of Prof Virus. She was pursuing medicine and was a qualified doctor too. She had a brother who committed suicide unable to bear the pressure of forced studied. He wanted to study literature but his father forced him to take up science and sit for entrance of ICE. Kareena also had an elder sister who got married. The trio gatecrashed in her marriage ceremony and got caught. While convincing Kareena that Suhaas is not the right guy for her, Rancho explains how to know when one is in love. There is a pleasant air, whispering light music and everything happens in slow motion. It's like time has stopped. We do find people like Suhaas in our life who only talk about the price tag.

When the librarian told the meaning of "chamatkar", chatur immediately replied that he doesn't want to know the meaning of every word in speech. He will just cram it up and then deliver on the function day. The most common attitude of people on campus. Nobody changes with time but people get to know themselves with time. And that is how, they improve. Chatur remained the same in more than 10 years. He crammed, he farted, he conspired. Later on he became successful. He has a beautiful wife, a $ 3.5 m mansion, a Lamborghini and what not. He boasts it all.

Rancho expressed his disappointment over the system. He had some ideas. Like bookish knowledge should not the measure of learning. Grades should not be displayed in public view. Innovation and experiments should be encouraged and failure should not be frowned upon.

title: gives sunshine and rain both ------- amazing
review:
3 idiots in one line is simply amazing movie in many respects. the story as we know from chetan bhagats novel - 5 point someone , was already a huge hit. to have the vision of creating the story into such good movie deserves praise to movie director - raju hirani. in the movie you feel like u r back in ur college again. chemistry between friends is showed to perfection. whats stands apart in this movie is AAMIR portrayal of RANCHO character to perfection. each and every line in the movie makes you laugh and makes sense also. that is very rare in a Hindi movie where laughter = chaos. also kareena , madhavan , joshi ,and boman did their roles well. in fact boman is very much like our dean . so see each and every one can relate to this movie which makes it amazing.

again kudos to raju hirani , aamir and every member of this movie.

must see movie .......................

title: 3 Idiots - Nothing Idiotic About This?
review:
Give me some bad words, give me some taunts. Give me another chance; I want to be critical on 3 idiots at least once.

Unfortunately, I couldn't get a Rancho to fulfill this dream of mine.

If only someone else would have played Rancho other than Aamir Khan, this movie would have been some what mediocre. Its class of Aamir's acting and timing which makes 3 idiots a special movie.

Mind you it's not a path breaking movie like Taare Zameen Par neither a ground breaking revolutionary movie like Rang De Basanti, its actually a mild reminders to those who have lived their entire life for something they never wanted to do. It says out loud "Give them another chance; so that they can grow up once gain".

Aamir as Rancho enters to lives of people who always had a dream ready to erupt in their heart but unfortunately their social and moral responsibilities were holding their hands from long. Not only Rancho teaches his friends to live up to their dreams but also teaches lesson of moral responsibility to people like Viru (The principal), this all comes with a brisk smile and amazingly casual attitude.

The storyline has been loosely based on five point someone of Chetan Bhagat but there has been many alteration for good. It's not the story though which keeps you alive but the small bits and pieces which sometimes brings a broad smile (When Aamir & company says "All izz Well") and at times keeps your heart overwhelmed (Especially when Raju's father gets admitted to hospital). It has got some moments which makes you crave to give a tight slap to Virus (The principal) when he is at his best, harassing students. There are some laugh out loud moments special mention for the speech at Teacher's Day celebration. This is a complete masala movie with class of its own, some where in league of Munna bhai, No wonder it's coming from the same director Raju Hirani.

What I like about Aamir Khan's movies is although he has central character but all other characters have their fair share of work. You would not see Aamir overloaded on each reel but still he will leave the best footprint. He excels and every time proves why he is known as "The Perfectionist". One more feather to his cap, way to go t Other than Aamir, Bomen Irani has played a remarkable role. As a cruel and heart less educationist, he played his role at par to anyone. You will love to hate him till the end.

Sharman Joshi is one man who connects to audience effortlessly. He has played his lower middle class son's role impeccable. Kareena is her short but effective role of Pia is very impressive. She comes as a fresh breeze, every time with her scintillating charm mesmerizing the audience. The role of a jealous and self-centered geek Chatur ramalingam is one of the best portrayal of a non-protagonist in recent time. Only disappointment was Madhavan, with an actor of his caliber this was a very low profile character.

Music is also very nice, specially "Give me some sunshine"; it surely took me back to my days at college. All izz well is surely a new anthem for young generation. Zubi Dubi is also a nice viewing. Director must be given most of the credit for making such a young movie with lads way above their projected age in movie. Excellent thought process and characterization; he surely is one of the most creative directors we have. Cinematography is also exotic especially when lense captured best of Shimla and Ladakh.

The movie also gives an important message of how growing pressure on performance is driving young generation into depression and makes them to take wrong decisions in life. It also tell you not to run behind success but work for excellence and success will follow. As always Raju Hirani has gone with a message.

Although their are some unnecessary instances towards end which prolongs the end but still It's a must must watch for all moviegoers and special watch for those who doesn't see movies as well.

title: Watch it, and you watch it again....
review:
Movie that's worth every single penny you spend on the ticket is - 3 IDIOTS.

There have been times, people enter theater with loads of expectations from a movie - all to be thrashed. Lemme tell you, however high your expectations are, they'll be fulfilled by these "idiots". Talk about story, screenplay, script or acting, a perfect mixture of all is this product. Unless you're a film critic, you'll not be unhappy about the movie in any way.

I'll suggest you must go and watch the movie, once. And I bet, you'll be tempted to go again.

title: Indian fans push not so great movies into IMDB top 100
review: Not saying this is a too bad movie. But it should not find its place in here. Indian fans en masse rating the indian movies with a perfect 10, pushes unworthy Indian movies into top 100. And knocks really great international movies down below. Laughable that this goof up movie stays much above the well made classic Amadeus.

title: review
review:
Life is all about listening to your heart and chasing your dreams. That's the essence of 3 IDIOTS, directed by the supremely talented Rajkumar Hirani. Let me come to the point right away. There are films and there are more films. And then there's 3 IDIOTS.3 IDIOTS belongs to everyone. But, yes, there's no denying that Aamir makes you forget all his past achievements as you watch the amazing actor play Rancho. To state that this ranks angst his finest works would be an understatement. Madhavan is incredible, especially in the sequence when he explains his point of view to his father. Sharman is outstanding from start to end. This was a difficult role to portray and only an actor of Clare could've pulled it off. Boman is superb as the vicious head of the institute. The scenes between Aamir and Boman are extra-ordinary and it's a treat to watch these two powerful actors clash on the big screen, without getting over dramatic. Boman's appearance, mannerisms and dialogue delivery are exemplary.

The length of Kareena's role may not be as much as Aamir, Madhavan and Sharman, but she registers a strong impact nonetheless. Omi is excellent and the viewers are sure to love his acidic tongue and gestures in the movie. Mona Singh doesn't get much scope. Jaaved Jaffery is competent. Pareekshit Sahani is decent.

On the whole, 3 IDIOTS easily ranks angst Aamir, Rajkumar Hirani and Vidhu Vinod Chopra's finest films. Do yourself and your family a favors: Watch 3 IDIOTS. It's emotional, it's entertaining, it's enlightening. The film has tremendous youth appeal and feel-good factor to work in a big way. A new platform has been ad for us which not only provides us with the movie links but also helps in watching them online www.flickstree.com

title: A Bollywood Classic Comedy
review:
3 Idiots is an Indian comedy directed by Rajkumar Hirani, with a screenplay by Abhijat Joshi, and produced by Vidhu Vinod Chopra. It features stars Aamir Khan, Kareena Kapoor, R. Madhavan, Sharman Joshi, Omi Vaidya, Parikshit Sahni and Boman Irani.Chetan Bhagat's best-selling novel 5 Point Someone makes the leap to the big screen in this comedy about three engineering students whose friendship stands the test of time.

As Farhan and Raju search the valleys for their missing friend Rancho , their memories drift back to the days when they we're all college roommates, and Rancho incurred the wrath of their headstrong dean Viru Sahastrabudhhe by daring to propose radical theories that directly contradicted his teacher's lessons. Later, Rancho begins dating Virus' daughter Pia, and gradually begins to gain the dean's respect. Flashing back to the present day, Farhan and Raju uncover some previously unknown facts about their old friend that leads them to question everything they ever thought they knew about him.

A fabulous achievement across the board. A typical Bollywood confection but also social commentary on a dysfunctional engineering school system that pressures huge numbers of students into suicide.Also,the movie is very much a character-driven piece, which not only makes the laughs bigger but also earns a deeper involvement as the viewer deeply cares for the characters involved.Overall,this is a classic comedy.

title: likable if bloated screwball comedy
review:
When it comes to running-time, why does Bollywood treat every movie as if it were a sweeping historical epic on the order of a "Lawrence of Arabia" or a "Doctor Zhivago?" A case in point: "3 Idiots," an amiable enough little screwball comedy that has been padded out to a wrist-slashing 164 minutes. It also happens to be the most commercially successful Bollywood feature ever released in India. Go figure.

The story centers around a trio of promising but mischievous young engineering students who rebel against the high-pressured rigidity - both academic and personal - of the exclusive school they're attending.

"3 Idiots" has two things going for it: its cranked-up energy level and its appealing actors, especially Aamir Khan, who portrays the ringleader of the group. These alone are enough to compensate for the silliness of much of the action, the corniness of the jokes (with irritating cue music in case we couldn't pick up on the corn on our own) and the stickiness of the sentimentality. And, in its own playful way, the movie makes some important points about the intense pressure placed on Indian children to achieve beyond their parents' wildest expectations, and about the need to pursue the path that will make one most happy in life.

It's a pretty entertaining feature, overall; I just wish it didn't take so darn long to play itself out.

title: Now..that's what I call a movie, about time!!
review:
Well, I guess my sub-heading sums out what I feel about this film! For those who do not know, this film is brought to you by those who gave you the Munnabhai series and for those who have not seen this, would definitely recommend. Once again this team of producers do not disappoint! Add in Aamir Khan to it and you have a masterpiece. Not because of the location of where the film is produced, or because they show every young actor wearing a branded designer garment or using technology (or how i refer to as Sugar coating)to cover up a poor story line, but they actually use a very serious topic that involves the flaws of their education system and tells a story in a unique and clever way that as a film lover you will enjoy, yet you will understand the message they are trying to portray.

Not generally being a fan of Bollywood movies due to its unrealistic story lines and OTT (over the top) acting and agonisingly long movies, I must say two and a half hours for this movie was short as it was very entertaining.

Not being fluent in Hindi, I was being reliant on the subtitles for this movie, so I guess I missed some classic jokes and their meanings, as when translated they probably are not as funny, but nevertheless, when i say that this movie is hilarious, I mean HILARIOUS! Ingenious comedy not slap-stick OTT things that Bollywood is branded for.

Most of the other reviewers have all commented about the movie and the storyline and actors, so for me to repeat all of that wouldn't be wise. But on that note, I would like to mention one actor who of course is Aamir Khan, this guy is a legend! Please do not misinterpret me when I say that he was the only person who made this film a success because that would not be fair, the supporting cast did a very good job and many of the actors have definitely not done their careers any harm but the reality is people paid money to watch Aamir and not the other actors and once again he delivered. He is like the Tom Hanks or Tom Cruise of Bollywood (in their Prime)who is an actor or should I say an artist who always tries to better himself and raise the bar as high as he can, by trying different roles and not being type casted. Aamir has probably played most roles now through from comedy to historical and etc and in each one he grows as an actor.

Similar to the marketing tool, the Maslow Hierarchy of needs, where it shows the stages of life a person has to go on before they are satisfied before moving to the next level, Aamir would be be near the top where the basics of acting and making a name for himself have been accomplished, also making money would now be his least of worries, but to change cinematography, tackle political problems of the country, make a difference to others and to be an innovator/ a pioneer rather then a follower is the steps he is taking.

This film will surely be an epic in years to come and hopefully not just the directors but also fans should wake up and see that this is the sort of quality they should expect and support if they really want to be respected in worldwide cinema. Drop all these fancy locations, Western type of life styles, bad acting and repetition of story lines instead, concentrate on writing meaningful and an innovative story lines that will inspire and make India proud. And what is this with every film trying to be produced in different countries? India is a beautiful country with many riches, great locations, landscapes etc as showed in this film, as some scenery shots are magnificent and breath taking that you wonder what makes people want to film abroad when there is still so much to show of India?..TOURISM IN India..take note! this is your chance to show how beautiful your country is, use this to show the world how great we are.

And with that I conclude, without giving the story away at all where just like the film Avatar, this is the making of a movie that will inspire others and change cinematography forever. WATCH THIS MOVIE on the big screen! To feel the real power of 3 idiots and other people's reactions to this classic!! ENJOY!!

review:
i just don't know, how to explain the movie in words.

title: Intelligent Script plus Munnabhai-esquire fun = a sure entertainer
review:
Coming from the director of the “Munnabhai” series, on the face of it, 3 idiots is a complete 'paisa vasool' (value for money) comedy. As with his earlier flicks, it has benign intentions at heart, and some lessons for the system. Vis-à-vis a goon do-gooder there, you have an enigmatic genius here who seems turn everything that he touches into gold; which includes smiles, encouragement, healing, love, creativity, tears and some hard lessons.

The system under attack here is similar to that in Aamir’s previous masterpiece “Tare Zameen Par”: Education as he steps up his ire from schools to professional colleges that emphasize on cramming and bagging ranks. One of the gags says: “if you don't run, you'll be like a broken anda (egg)”. Facing the attack is the fictional Imperial College of Engineering, modeled on the famed IITs and shot on campus at IIM Bangalore.

Drawing inspiration from Chetan Bhagat’s ‘5 point someone’, it tracks the lives of its 3 protagonists Ranchhoddas Chanchad or Rancho (Aamir Khan), Farhan Qureshi (R Madhavan) and Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi) through their college days, their battles with the dictatorial Director Viru Sahasrabuddhe or ViruS (Boman Irani) and a dabbles into Rancho’s love interest and ViruS’ daughter and a doctor, Pia (Kareena Kapoor).

3 Idiots also tackles issues such as pursuing a stream of education against one’s own creative interests or heart’s calling, teaching a hard lesson to ragging seniors and an odd lesson to slimy nerds. While he goes about things, he gets Pia to fall for him too. Rancho’s bold methods irk ViruS, the similar antagonist from Hirani’s Munnabhai. Of course, as must all movies end, Rancho opens up ViruS’ eyes towards the end.

The funniest scene in undoubtedly is the one involving Rancho modifying Chatur’s speech. While it had to praise ViruS for his ‘chamatkar’ (miracles) in the college, the modified ‘balatkar’ (rape) brings out the reality. With Omi Vaidya delivering it to rote perfection, you’d be rolling on the floor laughing. Here, don’t also miss Hirani’s lesson that mugging up without understanding is ‘balatkar’ of knowledge.

While it’s not all perfect, there are times when the drama is overdone, especially the delivery scene on a TT table! But considering its other goodies, overlooking this is quite easy. The best goodie comes in the form of editing wherein it weaves the past and present events as Farhan and Raju accompanied by a vengeful Chatur try to unearth the whereabouts of the ‘real’ Rancho who disappeared during the convocation.

Aamir Khan is synonymous with quality films. It’s another thing though that I found last year’s "Ghajini” purely average and it turned out to be a hit. But, with 3 Iditots, his sole release for this year, Aamir, in my reckoning is back to his glory days of “Tare Zameen Par”. If the rave reviews and BO collections are to be believed, 3 idiots is a Smash-Hit. If you have still not seen this meaningful laugh riot, rush now for a bite of its 'gyaan' (wisdom).

title: The three idiots show us what is wrong with our current system of education
review:
Aal iz not welleducation system

Rajkumar Hirani and Vidhu Vinod Chopra coupled with Aamir Khan have come out with an ingenious film. The film exposes the fact that the Indian Education System needs to be revamped and how well they do it. Picturized in trademark Hirani style, the film is a must watch for every student and parent. The current scenario where teachers feel that whatever has been taught in class is the only thing that the student needs to learn and a scientific or questioning mind is not welcome in the classrooms is shown in good humour. The student too gets conditioned to this rote learning or falling in line syndrome for earning favours from the teachers. The setting is in a premier engineering college of the country ICE where three students are thrown into the situation because their parents wanted them to do so. This is so true of innumerable students who are just following their parents diktat in opting for engineering. Madhavan wants to get into wildlife photography but is forced into ICE. Sharman has to do it because he has to succeed and support his family which is struggling for survival with an ailing father and a working mother and an unmarried sister of marriageable age.Aamir Khan is the odd man out in the trio with a penchant for technology and a sharp and questioning mind. But these threesome are found unfit by the college director (Boman Irani) . In the leadership of Aamir Khan they thwart the college's efforts to punish their waywardness but to no avail . By the time they reach the final year there are two groups – one the studious , loyal types and the other is the threesome who are mischievous and non-conforming. Time and again they pester the college authorities with their pranks .Aamir is not the serious study variety but is successful in topping the exams . This point drives home the issue that if you have the passion you can do it – you don't need to cram.After being rustigated from college, Boman changes his heart and takes them back because their ingenuity saves his daughter as they help her deliver her child in extraordinary circumstances and with the help of Kareena , who is a doctor and also Boman's daughter. Aamir disappears after his college only to be traced by his friends in what is the ultimate goal of his passion. The gags, jokes, ragging scenes, classroom sequences, romantic scenes, gatecrashing into marriages and all such bits in the movie are so realistic that all of us would have done the same in the colleges. Aamir is superb and looks the college student. He fails to surprise because each time he surpasses himself and has the uncanny knack of choosing the right films.Madhavan and Sharman support him to the hilt as true friends who are ready to crashland flights, gag car owners and ditch the college authorities to support each other. The light-heartedness is there but there are some touching family scenes too which makes the movie one of the best in recent times. Raju Hirani proves to be a master storyteller again. Swanand Kirkire's lyrics are youthful and meaningful. Shantanu Moitra's music is adequate but is the only mediocre thing in an otherwise brilliant film.Boman is his usual hilarious with grey shades . Kareena is beautiful .

title: 3rd time lucky for Hirani with 3 Idiots
review:
Rajkumar Hirani has succeeded once again! This film is right up there with, if not over and above, the Munnabhai films.

Everyone played their parts exceptionally well in this must see blockbuster comedy. Aamir Khan has now become an actor who chooses his films and roles with perfection. Boman Irani (the only actor who has appeared in all of Rajkumar's films) failed to disappoint once again.

There were side-splitting scenes that I will remember for life, but I do not want to give these away. They will have to be seen before they can be believed!

With every good story, there is always an underlying and important message. In this film, it is the following: "Every person in this world is born with a gift and a passion, which cannot morally be forced upon that person." An inability by Indian families to recognise this fact of life is leading to tragic consequences, which can tear such families apart.

For me, 3 Idiots has made the end of 2009 an ever-lasting memory. May this film win as many awards as possible!

title: Hirani's & Aamir's Best till Date!
review: Whoa Whoa Whoa ! Just watched this gem movie ,and gotta say ,this is probably the most entertaining movie I've ever seen in My life and probably Yours too. Wont spill out any spoilers here but would of course stamp Excellent Performance!on each and every actor of this movie Bows for Aamir ! Must add I had watched Avatar just yesterday and though it was fascinating it was not as influential and touching as 3 idiots. Theater response was too good , and that dhan-chamatkar scene was simply Way too Hilarious . For those whom it itches the fact of Aamir is playing a college kid, Aamir initially refused to act but later accepted this as a challenge improvised it an crafted role to Perfection. Sharman's scenes were also amazing few were tear jerking while while few were Hilarious , Maddy especially excelled in His Father Son argument scene . Also length wise it is perfect; and choreography , hostel scenes and few emotional scenes were executed with perfection .

title: Aal Iz Well :)
review:
The film was brilliant! No words about it! I actually don't have words to praise the movie, but "All is well" with the movie! The movie was an excellent piece of cinema and also one of the best films of the decade in bollywood. Aamir Khan has made me his fan! He is the best and the most versatile actor in the world! This guy looked the most young in the movie, being 44 he played the role of a 23yr old! Madhavan looked a little old for his role but his acting was tremendous, Sharman Joshi was mind blowing! Boman Irani was excellent as usual! Kareena was fine! The screenplay & dialogues by Rajkumar Hirani and Abhijat Joshi were hilarious at times (sometimes it made my jaw hurt), but were also eye opening in parts! The movie was a train ride, and the stops were emotion, drama, comedy, suspense (for a while), and much more. The direction was an absolute delight and the cinematography was refreshing and great (especially the aerial shot of the car going to shimla). The music was also excellent.

Points.

AAMIR KHAN 20/10.

DIALOGUES 20/10.

DIRECTION 20/10.

STORY 20/10.

SCREENPLAY 20/10.

ENTERTAINMENT 100/10.

On the whole, the film is a first day first show must watch and if you haven't watched it, go for it today!!! It is the best film released so far in the year, and in the history of films!!! NO FILM CAN BEAT IT.

IF YOU ARE DOING ANYTHING TODAY, LEAVE IT AND GO WATCH 3 IDIOTS!!!

title: Rajkumar Hirani creates a Masterpiece !!!
review:
Well to start off, 3 idiots itself starts of brilliantly by introducing Farhan Qureshi (Madhavan) and Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi). Boman Irani is once again at his best playing the Principal of the college Viru Sahastra Buddhe (VIRUS).

Both of those friends are informed that their dearest friend Ranchoddas Chanchad (Aamir Khan) is returning. Shocked by the sudden disappearance long ago, both these friends come to the place where they have been called for, desperate to meet their Best Friend. But something else is waiting for them at that place.

The movie has been wonderfully directed with scenes continuously revolving around the past and present at perfect intervals of time. The story revolves on how Ranchoddas witnesses the scenes of depression and sadness among students who are often dejected due to lack of scoring grades and supporting family pressures. In the mid time, Ranchoddas falls in love with the Principal's daughter Pia (kareena kapoor) very fine acting by her too.

Well, not revealing anything more, the three characters have been wonderfully played by Madhavan, Sharman and Aamir. The movie has loads of comedy at many times but also delivers a strong and subtle message to all its viewers. Even the supporting characters have done their role exceptionally well which adds more to the fun quotient. All credits go to Rajkumar Hirani and Abhijit Joshi for plotting this script and directing it perfectly.

The music can be rated 10/10 as it creates such a high emotion while watching the movie. Well to round it up, get a ticket for yourself now, no matter how high the price is !!! You ll definitely enjoy the movie though it turns out to be lengthy. (2 hours 50 minutes).

Watch it now. It is a total family entertainer. Enjoyable for all ages. A Blockbuster soon to be.

title: Problem with subtitles
review:
This appears to be a brilliant, funny movie. But there's a BIG PROBLEM if you don't speak Hindi. At least my copy has less than 10% of the dialog in subtitles.

An entire 4 minute speech, with everyone laughing, had absolutely NO subtitles. Huge parts of the dialog, literally minutes go by with people talking back and forth, apparently with funny, witty dialog, and finally the last sentence just says "come." I am enjoying the movie but missing so much. Not sure if I have an early release or what? Actually, even the dialog that is translated is quite poor...sometimes the wrong word is used.

The parts of the movie that I could follow are really charming. The actors have great facial expressions and quirky moves. I love the whole parody of the Indian education process for engineering.

title: Speechless-Aamir Rocks Yet Again!!!!
review: Excellent movie. Easily one of my top 5 movies of all times. Superb acting by everyone in the movie...especially Aamir Khan, Boman Irani and Sharman Joshi. I hope they get awards for their performances. Script was excellent with a very important message. And despite its comedy genre, it proves to become an easy classic of bollywood cinema. Songs aren't the greatest but still seem to do OK and fit; movie is greatly focused on the plot. Aamir Khan once again proves to have the touch of gold exceeding his excellence in his film. Just when you think he broke the Bollywood records with Ghajini, he does it again with 3 Idiots by a mildstone. He's truly the greatest actor in bollywood history....and deserves the title of King Khan!!!

title: Contemporary cinema at its best.
review:
You watch 3 Idiots and realize that Aamir has done it again ! It started with Rang De Basanti which instilled the passion of truthfulness to Taare Zameen par which was a message about child-centric creativity, the similar ideas are propounded in 3 Idiots.

3 Idiots is a mixture of realism and Bollywood Masala which targets a very important, yet subtle issue of our Indian society. Considering that fact that most of the population in India is young and further that most of them pursue sciences as their degree and compete with a gargantuan mass of peers to stand where they are right now, the story just aims to get some saneness in our society, which the old wise men argue and the younger ones forget. Think and learn things for the love of knowledge, rather than the desire of success. It highlights the essential flaw in our system, that the person studying in IIT's and IIM's is not because of his passion for technology/managing skills but because of his academic abilities.

A contemporary theme executed with contemporary brilliance and carefully dramatized masala to keep the audience entertained. If the medium budget films did well last year, mainly because of the realism in them, big budget like this has all the ingredients for a blockbuster. The plot focuses of inventive thinking, engineering design which, I , personally well relate to and share similar opinions. The plot is like any Masala movie, with a protagonist which desires a change in opinions and a climax which shatters the mindset of the pessimist, a love story, a friendship packed with chirps of comic relief. The strong theme just completes the movie and drives the message straight to the eye. Aamir deserves most of the credits for his acting while Vidhu Vinod Chopra and his team have done a commendable job with the sets, locales and editing and lighting. Hats Off ! 10/10

P.S. : before watching the movie, i was shocked to hear a German and a Ukranian going bonkers about the movie. such is the brilliance of contemporary bolly cinema.

title: 3 Idiots has lots of subtle gay references to it
review: The movie has lots of subtle gay references to it, something that is frowned in Indian cinema. While none of the characters are portrayed as gay, the numerous references made to the male buttocks are enough to make one take note. It is referred to as a "gift that is being requested for acceptance" at the new students initiation ceremony, with many of the new students strutting and gyrating in just their underwear, including a scene with an underwear pulled down slightly to reveal a side of the buttock, with a stamp of approval on it, like it was certified A+ grade meat, or beef (gay male). In addition the name of the hero (Amir Khan) in the movie is too long to say at the initiation, and is considered to be "quite a mouthful". There is another scene in a song where all three lead actors are seated with their backs to the camera, on seats that have the shape of male buttocks, and then turn around while seated in them and rub the buttock shaped seats with their hands while smiling suggestively. There is also a song where the students are taking baths but that could be considered to be as communal shower although with the shorts covered with loin cloths. Other scenes include pants dropped to the ankles from time to time, with some scenes also involving turning of the person to the camera and whacking it to be accepted in defeat with the pants down. It might be overlooked as being funny, but these scenes are heavy in gay overtones. Otherwise just another Indian movie with a strong message of friendship.

title: Good movie
review:
Rajkumar Hirani returns with a bang after his Munnabhai series with 3 Idiots The film which caught people's attention ever since launched

The film brings together Aamir, Sharman and Madhavan after RDB where they didn't have much interaction together as Aamir-Sharman had many scenes together but yet there was a huge crowd and Maddy had a short role

The movie rocks

It combines escapist madness with a sensible approach very well which is trademark of Raju Hirani

The film starts off well but the best part starts when the college scenes start, the ragging scene, Aamir's interaction with the professor, Joe's death and Aamir's outburst at his funeral Aamir teaching Boman how to teach are many scenes which are brilliant

There are many more too brilliant scenes and the interval shocks you

The mystery is solved soon and then the journey goes ahead The drunken scene and Aamir's proposing to Kareena is fantastic

Sharman's suicide and the following scenes till his interview are brilliant The film catches your attention throughout and the characterizations too are well written The delivery scene though a bit too filmy has the right emotional value and the climax is very good The film does remind you of Munnabhai MBBS many times like Aamir- Boman scenes are similar to Sanju- Boman and also he loves his daughter.etc but it's forgivable

Direction by Rajkumar Hirani is very good Music is very good too

Aamir Khan looks younger and does the smooth talking college guy brilliantly, his emotional outbursts, humour and also his romance scenes are all fantastic Though he has done such roles in DCH and RDB yet he lends something new Sharman Joshi gets a meaty role and has come a long way He excels in the dramatic scenes and comic scenes He makes you laugh just by his expressions and it's nice to see the actor being a part of A list films now Madhavan too excels in his part especially when he explains his point of view to his father Kareena is good too in her smaller role Amongst rest Boman handles his role which has shades of Dr Asthana with a lisp added very well Omi is fantastic Parikshit Sahni repeats his LRMB act but is good rest are good

title: All is well...?
review:
The prospect of a knockabout comedy that lasts for over 160 minutes isn't an enticing one, but luckily the title "3 Idiots" is something of a misnomer. There's some broad humour, "comedy" characters and lots of scatological references, but also depictions of suicide and reflections on the human condition. Western audiences may find this tonal inconsistency hard to take, as an onscreen suicide by hanging is followed by one of many songs.

The fifth Aamir Khan movie I've seen, he's an always likeable and engaging presence, but one criticism is that his characters never seem realistically flawed (Save for Dangal). Always the wisest person in the room, his "think outside the box" method of living embodies many of his portrayals and his passing of philosophy to his fellow students borders on preaching. Khan has the likeability and charisma to pull this off and prevent it from being too cloying, but in a movie where he becomes a famous scientist, redevises an entire system of learning and delivers a baby, it's something of a surprise to see him near a mass of water at the end of the movie and not start walking on it.

Currently on Netflix in the UK, there is some issue with the meaning of words and phrases being changed when translated: I know enough to realise that the subtitled "ass" said around an hour into the movie is really "dog", but I wasn't aware that balatkar (rape) was said throughout the doctored speech scene, with it changed to a more benign "screwed" for the UK audience. An interesting article on how the difference in ratings between men and women could be divided (https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/what-if-online-movie-ratings-werent-based-almost-entirely-on-what-men-think/) shows that this film would be over a hundred places lower if only the votes from women were taken. All, it seems, is not well.

title: 3 Idiots: Innumerable Errors and Hollow Theme
review:
Well this is disappointing. The film's a whole major part is fake and based upon fakeness. The story is about three friends 2 of whose lives were heavily influenced by 3rd one. And that's no doubt will be AmirKhan. The film is irritating in matters of its content. I mean all the false understanding are displayed so confidently and that too with standard technical's that people will believe them to be true esp. the young people. I feel this movie should get out of IMDb top 250 list. This movie proves that INDIANS are still yet to be matured in understanding things. If you don't believe me just look at its number of voters.
The movie doesn't inspire education or any related matters. It inspires blindness and loose moral values. Amir Khan is an expert in cheating the world about his identity and he is the hero of the movie!!!!!. Guess about the rest of the movie. His friends were good at first but in meeting Amir they too were influenced by him and turned to loose minds. This type of loose attitude is not good for education and the director is serious about giving the message through them!!.
The comedy is not at all good I mean it's low standard. Low state minds will keep laughing at that. Raj Kumar Hirani disappointed me in making this because it reflects the negative-devilish-immoral aspect of the society. He spent millions of rupees in this for no good reason. I mean if he wanted to display the true Nature of the IDIOTS he would showed the characters in villainous ways or the dangers idiots lead society to. But he misunderstood the right from wrong and he showed just the opposite. There is no truth in this movie. Sometimes negative Characterization is also displayed in the movie and that is also acceptable but it must be shown in right way just like The Godfather, Requim for a dream, Arth, Legend of Bhagat Singh. Etc. They all depict the negative sides of society and still they reflect the truth. I think 3 IDIOTS is a type of fantasy movie but STILL if it is a fantasy one then there must be some type of beauty or aesthetic sense in its storytelling or in its presentation or in the story-line etc but that is 100% absent. 2/10 is for BomanSir who played Viru Sahastrabuddhe.

title: One of my favorite movies of all time
review: It's so strange reviewing this movie after almost 10 years of its release. But after watching it again for the 50th time (no joke) I knew I had to write a review. I remember watching this movie when it was first released in theaters. As an 11 year-old Indian- American my hindi was pretty bad and some of the comedic scenes such as the one where Chatur was giving the speech in front of his school and made a mess (which i consider one of the best comedic scenes in any movie) went right over my head. Even the central message of the film which was to not follow success, but to do what you love and that success would follow you, was something I had still yet to understand. But now, watching this movie as a 20 year-old college student, really resonated with me. The trials and tribulations of being successful to appease your parents while also still battling the true aspirations that reside within you. All I can end this review by saying is this movie is truly a masterpiece and sure it did have some ridicoulous moments and scenes which could have been done without. But it's essence is timeless and even 30 years later, kids and adults alike will connect with this film.
