title: Quality Film.
review:
3 Idiots- 2009 Director: Rajkumar Hirani

What can be expected from Amir Khan? QUALITY ! 3 idiots suits the term 'landmark cinema' and has all it takes to help Bollywood take a giant step into world cinema with pride. It is a sparkling example of qualitative cinema. 3 idiots not only entertains, it also enlightens the audience. First Bollywood film to reach 100 Crore Club. The story of 3 idiots has been told differently and offers so many twists-n-turns that you just can't guess what would unfold next.There's so much happening in every scene and the screenplay is so gripping that you don't feel the need to look at the auditorium ceiling or at your watch at brief intervals. An Aamir Khan film is nothing short of an event. The supremely talented actor acts in one film a year and no two films are ever identical in terms of plot line. Much more can still be summarized about the film. Lovely!

title: Enjoyable But Falls Far Short Of "Taare Zameen Par"
review: I like Bollywood Films for the most part, and especially "Like Stars On Earth", "Outsourced", "Slumdog Millionaire", and "My Name is Khan", but "3 Idiots", while certainly entertaining and having a message that is a corollary to "Taare", it suffers from uneven storytelling, going from silly, broad, caricatured comedy one minute, to serious, realistic, highly emotional moments that elicit tears. Some characters are so over the top as to be almost Keystone Koppish, and others very genuine, and still others, rather inconsistent. Still, overall, an entertaining watch with a very worthwhile message to follow your dreams and make your work seem like play.

title: A Really Nice and Interesting Film
review: Well, it is a nice film to watch as it points out the problem of studying nowadays. People mainly memories the whole book but actually they don't understand the meaning, just like how Silencer being tricked. Besides, if you want to watch a film as leisure, well, this isn't a bad choice either! There are jokes (funny ones, not The Interview 2014 jokes) that make you laugh, like Rancho pretended to be a sheriff and warned Silencer that his life is in danger...if he don't aware the traffic while crossing the road. For me, my favorite part of the film is the ending, while Silencer discovered that Rancho is indeed Professor Wangdu. It is really nice to end a movie and it is really meaningful. So I strongly recommended this movie!

title: Too long; gets much better towards the end; ripe for a Hollywood remake
review:
A wonderful and uplifting if at times cheesy movie. This is quite possibly the first Bollywood film I've ever watched ---I am glad to have done so.

Suggestions:

This would have been a much better film had it been say 1 hr 50m instead of 2hr 50m in length. Cut back on some of the school and antics stuff. (But perhaps a lengthier film is standard in Bollywood? I do not know.)

The 10 years later stuff especially was good and should have taken up half the film rather than just one third.

All the suicides and suicide attempts were a bit too melodramatic and unbelievable. It'd be fine if it were really a reasonably accurate portrayal of school life in India---suppose say the average person attending one of these top schools is likely to be acquainted with at least one person who has attempted suicide primarily because of such matters. But I doubt there is anywhere in the world---even in India, China, Japan, Korea---where things get that extreme.

title: Aamir Khan WoW!!!
review: Aamir does it again. what a movie .from start to the end, hilarious moments.screenplay is fantastic. full on comedy and yet it never looses its heart. Aamir pulls off a 22 year old character with brilliance. never for once you feel you are watching Aamir Khan.It was rancho on screen. sharman and madhavan - I bow down to them. music looks OK on cd but during movie it worked as a plus point. situational tracks works in the favour of film. runtime may sound a bit too much but believe me, you wont know when the first half is over. second half may seem a bit too hilarious but apart from that its a masterpiece. gr8 aamir ,another brilliant movie.

title: Exceptional!!!
review:
One of the best movies ever created in the history of Bollywood. I watched the movie first day first show and at that time i was studying for admission in an engineering college,now i am studying in an engineering college and i kind of relate to the movie somewhat. But i am really interested in engineering. :)

It's based, very loosely, on Chetan Bhagat's smash-hit 'Five Point Someone', which is about three friends who bond for life over shared blood, sweat and tears, in the way only those who go through professional colleges brimming with brutal deans and hellish exams.

There are movies aplenty, but very few remain etched in your memory and possess recall value. Aamir is excellent as Rancho ,Madhavan and Sharman are perfect, Kareena is also good,Boman played director's character as good as it was possible. Thanks for the movie.

title: Really A Fantastic Movie 4 Us!
review:
Buckle up audience and get ready to be entertained, as the brilliant mind behind the Munnabhai Series (Rajkumar Hirani) and Mr. Perfectionist (Aamir Khan) are coming together for the first time. The marketing strategies followed have hit the right chord, especially the 'alternate reality gaming' which has become quite a rage. Will the sky rocketing expectation of the most awaited movie of the year be met? Can Mr. Perfectionist give his second Christmas blockbuster in a row?

3 Idiots does prove a worthy follow-up to the Munnabhai series for the Vinod Chopra- Rajkumar Hirani duo, and a sure-shot extension to the successful streak of Aamir Khan. This might not be '5 point someone' as Hirani promised, but it has all the ingredients to be 'Munnabhai 3' with several sequences, reminding us the classic tale of Laxmi Prasad Sharma.

The film won 40 accolades; among these are six Filmfare Awards including best film and best director, ten Star Screen Awards, sixteen IIFA awards and three National Film Awards. In January 2014, it was nominated in the Best Outstanding Foreign Language Film category for 37th Japanese Academy Awards.

title: Fully entertaining movie
review: 3 Idiots is a coming-age comedy and inspirational film directed by Rajkumar Hirani. The story of the film is similar to that of the famous novel Five Point Someone by Chetan Bhagat. This film is based on our Indian educational system which pressurizes the students and has an obsession for high grades. Aamir Khan as Rancho plays the role of a very bright student who motivates his friends pursue their passion and make a career out of it. R.Madhavan as Farhan who wants to become a wildlife photographer but was forced to pursue engineering because of his strict father . Sharman Joshi as Raju who is pursuing engineering with the goal of getting his family out of extreme poverty. Boman Irani as virus who plays the role of a strict college director who is highly competitive. Kareena Kapoor as Pia who plays the role of virus's daughter and falls in love with Aamir khan . The film goes very smooth. The film's first half includes ragging scene, confrontations with the professor, Chatur's speech and mournful meal at Raju's home. Overall the film depicts a very nice mingle of comedy, suspense and motivational. All the actors and co-actors done a commendable job. The music of the film was very soothing. The back ground music supports the film all through the movie. Overall depiction is fine. Some of the scenes are really emotional. Overall rating is excellent.Its definitely a one time watch.

title: It will make you laugh out loud. It will make your eyes moist. It will entertain you full on.
review: Amir Khan is known in Bollywood as Mr. Perfectionist. The movie lives up to his name. Amir does it differently than everybody else. He proved it time and again through movies like Lagaan, Ghajni, Tare Zameen Par etc. And in this movie also, it is Amir on whose shoulders the charm unfolds. This is about three students in India's top engineering college. Amir teaches us through this movie that one can attain all the satiable success and glory in this world as long as he chases his dreams. It is YOUR life so care less about what others have to say and believe in your own heart's voice. At times the movie is emotionally intense, for instance, when Raju (Sharman) tries to commit suicide, and it is also full of LOL moments, for example, almost all encounters of Rancho (Amir Khan) with the principal aka VIrus(Boman). To conclude, the movie is a complete package, arguably the best movie in the history of modern Bollywood. It earned over 200 crores in India alone, the first ever.

title: Humorous,Entertaining but not a 'Masterpiece'!
review: Pants down and Palms up!...A well directed cocktail by the 'Munnabhai' series famed director RajKumar Hirani,consists of good Humour n a social message,feel-good movie with a perfect entertainment quotient but somehow this very film failed to be called as a 'Masterpiece'...!!! ... *DIRECTION: We all know that Mr. Hirani always brings something new to his film...& this time he did not disappoint us too...Though the film is based on the fiction "Five Point Someone" of Chetan Bhagat,the film has its selfness due to it's awesome direction...!!! 8/10 ... * STORY: May the structure of the story remains unchanged but majority of the subplots n contexts were rewritten as the prime storyline which differs it from the original book-version of it n few of those changes seemed unnecessary n impractical to make it as a Film version with some Desi flavor of 'Five Point Someone'...! 8/10 ... * SCREENPLAY & Editing: Screenplay with new reformed storyline consists of some delectable 'idiotgiri',juvenile humors n tear-shedding moments but problem is that the core message got hammered out sometimes on the basis of Reality vs. 'Reel'ity...! Editing was good...! 7/10 ... * ACTING: Its the strongest part of the film!...Its a curious n eventful journey about 3 Friends who got admidmssion to a reputed Engineering College n all the threes were shared equal spaces on screen...So, its difficult to choose the main Protagonist...!!! Mr. Perfectionist Aamir Khan did another memorable n well apprising performance as Rancho... Sharman Joshi sparked as Raju n i think he spent most time on screen with his spontaneous appearance... R.Madhavan as Farhan did an excellent job as well as a narrator n also an actor... Kareena Kapoor was always a pleasure... Omi Vaidya did an amazing debut to the B-Town portraying the character of Chatur (Silencer)... Others were perfect at their roles but the Antagonist Boman Irani was the best among all....He Viru Sahastrabuddhe a.k.a. 'Virus' stood out in every criteria of shades of acting n impressed the audience most...IMO, the character of Javed Jaffrey went impractial sometimes...! 10/10 ... * MUSIC: This film shines with it's melodious n lovely Music composed by Shantanu Mukherjee... 'Jaane Nahin Denge Tujhe', 'Behti Hawa Sa Tha Woh' n 'Zoobi Doobi' are my personal favorites... 10/10 ... In a country where students are driven to suicide by their impossible curriculum, 3 Idiots provides hope. Maybe cinema can't save lives. But cinema, sure as hell, can make you feel life is worth living...& this is the significance of the film...But, the message "Success nahi,Excellence k piche bhago" did not seem realistic at all n unable to accommodate with our modern Education system as well as our daily life...! .... Anyway, Kudos to the whole team of the film for giving us a gripping,entertaining,humorous Comedy film with some good messages...A movie to be cherished for refreshing everyone's mind... Good one n treat to watch it! ..... Rating: 8/10 Must watch!

title: MY REVIEW: Non-Idiotic Bollywood Feel Good Fun!!
review: 3 Idiots. The greatest director of recent times shows that cinema is magical. He shows, you can club the mainstream masala in a purposeful film flawlessly. All you need is directorial excellence and magical touch of Rajkumar Hirani, supreme performances by as many as six actors in a single movie; Aamir Khan, R Madhwan, Sharman Joshi, Omi Vaidya, Boman Irani and Kareena Kapoor, a story that touches all generations especially youth, a water tight screenplay which feels like a roller coaster ride of fun, emotions, pain, drama, thoughts and new ideas. There are numerous outstanding scenes especially the comic ones. Music might sound a bit below average but in movie it is used intelligently and never holds the fun for you. All in all, it is simply no nonsense Bollywood main stream cinema which serves the masses and classes with equal ease and love.

title: Simply, awesome
review:
Brilliant. Simply, brilliant.

Simple but articulate story telling laced with lots of humor and lessons from life. A wonderful experience to watch as every single actor from Sharman, Madhavan, Boman, Kareena & Aamir deliver probably the best performance in a movie this year.

Aamir Khan is the best actor in town today after AB. Period.

His range is phenomenal and his characterization of 'Rancho' in this movie is positively brilliant. The small mannerisms, the walk, the smile, the attitude, the brilliance of a young person who's not restricted by the educational system, his positive attitude towards every thing in life, it's Rancho you are looking at. Not Aamir.

Aamir's ability to transform himself convincingly from the super-huge well-built temporary amnesia patient on a revenge spree in Ghajini to this whacked out college student, which is half the age he played in last movie shows his prowess as a master actor to transcend age barriers to play almost every role in the book.

This is THE best movie of 2009. Aamir again reigns supreme. Thank you Raju Hirani & Vidhu Vinod Chopra.

Cliché word, but I have to use it - FANTASTIC !! 10/10

P.S. Don't forget to say 'Aal Izz Well'

title: Three idiots is a coming of age movie with mixed feelings
review: I liked this movie. I watched this more than one when it came on the small screen too. The humor was tasteful,the character scripting was very clever and combined with the story and acting, this movie became the second highest grossing movie at least for today. But the only problem with this movie was trying too hard to make it a romantic film. It was a smart and humorous film, but it lacked romance and sensuality. Th directer tried too hard to make it look sexy, by giving us a Gross out lip lock moment at the end, I mean seriously, there is no chemistry between Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor and putting a kissing scene taking these two actors was not romantic at all. Chuck out the gross romance and this movie is delightful Kareena Kapoor acted really well, unexpectedly she made me laugh at her dialogs and comedy expressions. She really looked like a Science student.The other two actors were the reason why this film was a hit. Boman Irani, you are the best comedy actor of the decade in Hindi cinema. Even when he tried to look like a monster, he was a funny and hilarious monster. Sharman Joshi ! he's good looking, soft spoken and a great actor. And Madhavan though had a very different role in the movie confused me about his sexual orientation here. Madhavan 's movies as I have watched before where he was a power house as a lead role, this time din't really have much to do.

title: the review of 3 idiots and it does not contain spoilers.
review: 3 idiots a film which makes a viewer to think whether the film is a comedy or a serious one.It released in India at that time when making such type of film is risking all your money.Thanks to the director for taking such risks.I am writing this review so late because recently a Shahrukh Khan film named "Chennai Express" broke the records of 3idiots.Thats the mentality of public.I cannot understand how a film like CE can earn so much.Surely, in my thoughts people should understand the meaning of cinema,it is not only for entertainment and if it is for entertainment then that should be sensible.Now a another sensible film is released "Madras Cafe",according to me everyone should watch this movie.Its a called a sensible story.And if anyone wants to see bollywood entertainment film watch film like "Hera Pheri" and its sequels.

title: Its Aamir!! Aamir!! Aamir!! And a lovely, enjoyable screenplay
review:
Now, I MUST admit that I am not a north Indian. I don't understand Hindi and I am actually not an ardent fan of Aamir Khan. But after watching this movie, I just admire him so much that I can't even explain it. See his body language all over this movie. He may not have as much as acting scope as in many previous movies like Mangal Pandey, Lagaan, Gajini and all. But still, He just turned out to be a teenage student in this movie.

Watch his body language all over the film. See how we wears his dress. You just can't point his "ACTUAL" age. Before watching this movie, I had a doubt, how could a 44 year old "MAN" can act like a teen age "GUY". But he just proved that "HE" can. Being the oldest among the three leads, he makes feel like the youngest.

The scene when he elaborates "MACHINES"; I just felt like watching Rowan Atkinson. How can a man act both like Rowan Atkinson in his latest movie and like an action hero like Al Pacino in his previous film (Ghajini). He's just irreplaceable.

And the movie's screenplay, Wow!!!!! I should admit that There is still 20 minutes left to watch. But I just couldn't be patient to write a review for such a lovely movie. It is just Laugh Out Loud Movie. I am not Hindi guy and still I can laugh at many places. Watching with subtitles and still not every dialog's are loading. Still I am Rolling in floor. One thing that squeezes my mind is that, how can a commercial action hero do such a comical role without any care about his "IMAGE"? I agree, Akshay has already done it, but still, Isn't Aamir in a much more higher position than Akshay? (Am ignorant about Bollywood. So please adjust with it) Madhavan & Joshi had a very little scope in this movie I suppose. Yes, I still have 20 minutes left to watch. But I don't think that, this finishing 20 minutes will change my view from the previous 2:20 hours of the movie. This movie is planned to be remade in Tamil (my mother tongue). Sidharth of 'Striker' fame is doing Maddy's role. I don't think he would make some fortune with this character. But it IS sure, that Vijay of Tamil 'Pokiri' fame (which Salman remade in Hindi as "Wanted") who is doing Aamir's role, will hold back his Star value in Tamil Cinema after giving continuous flops.

Joshi's role is going to be done by Jeeva who is really a promising upcoming artist. He will be outperformed by Vijay in this movie which can be guaranteed.

Well, Its time for me to watch the remaining 20 minutes and enjoy.

title: One of the best Bollywood movies!
review:
3 Idiots is a fantastic combination and fusion of comedy, drama, suspense and an unconventional romance. Director Rajkumar Hirani has shown his brilliance and lead actor Aamir Khan displays his amazing acting talents. The movie's base concept is taken from the Indian novel 'Five Point Someone' by Chetan Bhagat, which in itself is quite noteworthy.

The plot of the movie is very unique and sets itself apart from hordes of other, generic Bollywood movies releasing today. I actually do not prefer to watch a lot of Bollywood movies but when something as brilliant as this comes along, I don't have a choice! The plot grabs you and keeps you tuned till the last minute. It's full of suspense too and has two time lines running in parallel.

The main climax of the movie will definitely surprise you but the standout points of the movie are it's comic scenes and dialogs and the message it gives out. The comic scenes are actually funny and will make you laugh out loud while not being stale and generic. The message it gives out about the education system pertaining in India today is spot on and accurate! And everyone wonders why it is a favorite amongst us students! The acting is top notch too and surprisingly even Kareena Kapoor acts decently! The standout actors are Aamir Khan for his role as Rancho and Boman Irani for his role as the crazy director of the college, Viru Sahashtra Buddhdev. He is one of the main reasons to see this movie! So there you have it folks. A movie which achieves great heights of success and is popular too. You don't have a lot of stuff which is qualitatively good and quantitatively known! Superb direction, plot, dialogs and acting. This movie is worth more than just a single watch!

title: Chetan Bhagat's story in and out
review:
This is a good movie...no doubt. The story absolutely belongs to Chetan Bhagat. Wish a writer's forum in US or any other developed part of the world takes notice of this. A writer's story taken but disowned systematically for what ever reason. This can happen only in India. Chetan Bhagat - the author of "5 Point Some One" is the one who deserves credit.

I do not know if any one can take another person's property and disown him systematically like the way it happens in India.

Frieda Pinto if she acted in a Hindi Movie Industry , she would have been systematically plotted against...

Movie is very good...all credits to all the actors. But please the story belongs to Chetan - The new Age Indian Author

title: Let Meaningful cinema go to the dogs......this is Good anyway.
review:
Before I penned down this review I managed to browse through a few of " Hated It" reviews. To be sure they were absolutely ridiculous ( barring a few honest ones) . I mean I don't have any right to dictate as to who should like which movie but after reading the reviews I felt a little nauseatic because almost all of them were steeped in vindictive propaganda and were not by any means not genuine critical appraisals.

O.K. the humour sometimes did touch on the cheap side of things. But let me assure you this movie was in no way any more deplorable or depraved or Low than DEV -D or Kaminey , if that is what these gung-ho critics want to say.

A sweet aberration from the novel, the movie has been well made. Individual performances vary like maxima -minima . While Aamir is ordinary , the supporting cast is exceptionally good. Sharman Joshi is a good actor who is being ignored . Omi Vaidya and his dialogues are great. The guy was suited to the role and he performed it well.

Boman Irani is always entrusted with difficult parts. I say this because in many movies he has been asked to play the role of a real life eccentric with reel life eccentricities.

Kareena is a big disappointment ( always has been ).

The music is ordinary . I hate the song Zoobie Doobie . It is monotonous , boring and shabby.

In the totality of things a great movie with some great defining moments. Even if you leave real;ism and social messages aside as also Aamir's hyped image , this movie is by all means a remarkable one and deserves to be watched once if not twice or more.

title: Most Entertaining Bollywood Movie till Date
review:
I am enthralled by the movie and would watch it again.I was taken back in time to my own college days and really for a moment I thought as though I was in involved in the story. The senseless competitiveness unmindful of the dreams of children and their ambitions was the central theme of the story. The song " Give me some sunshine " was a real tear jerker. I also wish I could go back in time and get a chance to do something different.

Acting by the leads were awesome. Boman Irani as the professor VIRUS was outstanding and I think one of the best too. Not to mention Silencer, (OMI) who plays the rattu popat also was very good indeed. Chetan Bhagat from whose novel (3 point someone) this movie based deserves credit, but unfortunately his name is not included. I look forward to watch such great Bollywood movies in the future. This movie has left such an impression on me, that I find it hard to watch any other movie lately. Kudos to the director for a fine movie

title: flawless
review:
Well, there are many reasons to watch this movie like great acting by its actors, good screenplay, nice chemistry between all the actors, but the best reason to watch this movie is to forget all your trouble and get devoured in the movie for 3 hours. 3 idiots succeed in the basic motive of a movie to engage its viewers completely from the beginning till the end. This movie takes you to a 3 hour trip which is full of comedy, emotions, drama..all the things which a viewer wants. Some scenes are so memorable that whenever you will think of those scenes they will gonna put a smile on your face, there will be no wonder if you will laugh like a mad man in the hall and accompanied by every person sitting around you.

This movie is awesome not because of one actor or a couple of actors, it is a joint effort of every member of this movie, that's why it would be not fair to take anyone's name.

For me, 3 idiots is just amazing and I would love to watch it again and again..

Sodon't miss this one, take some time out of your schedules and go for it with your friends and family, because this movie is worth of spending time and money.

title: After 'Jaadu ki jhappi' and 'Gandhigiri' its 'aal izz well'
review:
In a late scene from the film, 2 of the 3 idiots zip down their pants and pat their bottoms facing the third idiot. Rather than feeling gross at that instant, you have a lump in throat. For the zillionth time in a Hindi film, a bride runs away from the pheras on her wedding day. But the scene still doesn't come across as clichéd. For a group of all-male engineering students, to 'deliver' means to literally carry out a delivery operation on a woman in labour pain. And when the motionless newborn responds to a goodwill chant of 'aal izz well' in true-blue Manmohan Desai mode, you fail to find a fault in the filmi formula. That's the golden touch of Rajkumar Hirani.

So after successfully dispensing philosophies of 'Jaadu ki jhappi' in Munnabhai MBBS and 'Gandhigiri' in Lage Raho Munnabhai, Hirani incites a new philosophy of 'Aal izz well' in 3 Idiots. And like his doctrine, all is well in his helluva film.

Loosely based on Chetan Bhagat's bestseller Five Point Someone, 3 Idiots takes the plot much beyond the campus confines and the target audience much above the youth, for universal appeal. The story starts a decade after the graduation of college companions Farhan (R Madhavan) and Raju Rastogi (Sharman Joshi) who get a clue on the whereabouts of their missing third friend Rancho (Aamir Khan). As they set out on a road trip from Delhi to Shimla to Manali to Ladakh to find their friend, the narrative cuts to and fro into flashbacks as we are introduced to the three idiots in an engineering college.

Rancho clearly is different from anyone else in the college with his individualistic thought-process and rebellious attitude, which invites the ire of the college principal (Boman Irani) and affection of his daughter Pia (Kareena Kapoor).

Coming from Rajkumar Hirani, there was clearly a risk involved in the film's setting and characterizations for having a déjà vu effect with his first film. Boman Irani, as the principal, almost revives his disciplinarian dean characterization from Munnabhai MBBS which is more palpable with his disgust towards the rebellious protagonist, Rancho (akin to Sanjay Dutt) who is furthermore in love with his daughter (ala Gracy Singh). Nevertheless, Hirani's direction is so impeccable that without a conscious effort, the analogy never strikes your mind and the scenario never looks repetitive.

In his trademark style, Hirani grabs your attention from scene one with an unconventional opening to the film. Thereafter every single scene written in the screenplay (by Hirani and Abhijat Joshi) is not just relevant but also has a clear set objective – to be funny or be deeply poignant. Which means it either makes you laugh or cry and at some superlative instances do both simultaneously (which is an achievement). The writers have kept absolutely no room for any intermediate option.

title: The Best Bollywood movie I have seen for a Long Long Long Time
review:
"3 IDIOTS" is in my books on of the best Bollywood movies ever made over the past 20 years. The only few movies which come close to matching this are Gadar, Humraaz and Kaho Na Pyar Hai.

I am a bit biased about movies from 2000-2004 period since the BEST bollywood movies came in that period. After 2004 I was increasingly becoming Disheartened by movies which were coming out lacking any reality, screenplay, direction or story.

Before 3 IDIOTS I saw the movie "Blue" which signifies what I was talking about.

But 3 IDIOTS has broken all my problems. Bollywood is back with a BANG in making BRILLIANT MOVIES.

And 3 IDIOTS is BRILLIANT, simply and spectacularly BRILLIANT.

Aamir Khan has done it again. This will be his biggest hit since 1989 Starrer QSQT!.

The storyline of the movies represents Contemporary India where Parents decide the future of the children right from birth to selecting careers to even selecting Brides!.

This movie tries to show the unfortunate problems caused by it. Invariably Indian children destroy their careers by the same Parents unknowingly.

Second this movie clearly shows the "R0T IN THE Indian EDUCATION SYSTEM".

Indian education system was created by the British to create PEONS and not THINKERS.

The result was the though India got an Army of Engineers and Software professionals (and more recently army of MBA holders).....India was not able to innovate or produce something of SUBSTANCE since that required THINKING.

But unfortunately the Indian education system destroyed the aspects of THINKING among its students.

3 IDIOTS clearly shows the Problems in Indian education system and the need to change the attitude among professors and parents alike !!.

3 IDIOTS is a must watch **********STARS.

title: aamir did it again...........
review:
I waited for 3 idiots more than any movie in my life and watching this movie was a good experience.this movie have all things that a young audience want from a movie. movie raises questions on our education system and our mentality.

the story is based on three friends who got admission in engg. college,and become room mates in hostel.the main character rancho is a very funny and creative boy who do things in its own way and don't care about the system.everyone called them idiots because they were different from others.

This movie was full of fun from beginning to last,not a single lousy moment and did not loose it grip for any time. only at some moments there is lack of maturity and lack of depth in some scenes where they could do well.even they use all the old stuff and jokes but did it very well.

movie was very well adapted from novel"five point some one"which is one of my favorite novel.all actors acted very well specially aamir khan and Omi Vaidya(who played funny boy chatur).

rajkumar hirani did the good job,the movie was not better than munnabhai mbbs to me but still good movie.

this movie cannot be counted as a masterpiece but still i will give it 8/10.

title: Awesome movie! Must watch!
review:
A fun filled movie that takes you back to your college days and at the same time touch upon the age old topic of over-burdening education system in India. I loved it and this a must watch bollywood flick of 2009!

Aamir Khan looks unbelievably cute in this pic and his collection of Tees is awesome! And Sharman Joshi is as adorable as always! You will get some memorable comic dialogues out of this movie - especially the one comparing dhoklas with missiles :) Views of ladakh towards the end are very picturesque. Everyone acted really well and Boman Irani did a commendable job as 'Virus' - director of college. Even though the movie is longer than usual you will not be bored due to fast pace and never ending funny acts of 3 idiots! MUST-WATCH!
